column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Halden
#Text=Halden is a town and municipality in Østfold county in Norway .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By train
#Text=Halden is served by the Norwegian State Railway as the southern terminus of the Oslo -Halden line , which also continues to Gothenburg 3 times a day .
#Text=By Car
#Text=When entering the country from Sweden , turn right just after the Svinesund Bridge , and follow the road signs to Halden .
#Text=By Boat
#Text=You could take the boat from Sandefjord to Strømstad in Sweden .
#Text=From there , you can take the bus , or drive by car .
#Text=Estimate 30 minutes travel time from Strømstad .

#Text=If you own a boat of your own , sailing through the narrow Svinesund ( a part of the border fjord Iddefjorden ) brings you to Haldens beautiful guest harbour where you could stay for your visit .
#Text=By Bus
#Text=You could take the bus from Oslo to Halden ( and Strømstad in Sweden )
#Text=http://www.nettbuss.no/ekspressbuss/timekspressen. Estimate 55 minutes travel time from Strømstad and 2 hours from Oslo .
#Text=Get around
#Text=If staying inside the town , the best thing is to travel by foot .
#Text=There 's no long distances , and you get to see most of the town .
#Text=There are also frequent Town busses that cover the town center and nearest surroundings .
#Text=In daytime usually each 30 minutes .
#Text=See
#Text=Fredriksten fortress .
#Text=This is where the Swedish king Carl XII ( Charles XII)was killed - in 1718 - during the war between Sweden and Norway , at that time a province of Denmark .
#Text=Rød Herregård ( The Rød Mansion ) . is one of Norway 's most completely preserved manor houses .
#Text=It has retained its patrician appearance and original interior from the time that it was still inhabited .
#Text=Rød Manor contains one of the country 's largest private collections of arms .
#Text=The barn has been converted into a café and gallery .
#Text=The buildings are surrounded by a beautiful Baroque garden and an English landscaped garden .
#Text=While in town , you should take a walk in Busterudparken , located on the north side of the town .
#Text=It 's a small , but beautiful park .
#Text=From the park , walk down " Gågata " and take a look at the harbour .
#Text=Do
#Text=Go hiking in one of Haldens forests .
#Text=Bring your tent and stay a night in Boksjøen .
#Text=Go fishing in the Iddefjord , Berbyelva or one of the lakes .
#Text=Be aware that fishing anywhere else than in the Iddefjord requires a small fee .
#Text=Go bathing :
#Text=Take a bath in the iddefjord , Krussæther or one of the lakes .
#Text=Exploring the town .
#Text=Visit all the bars at one night and get drunk .
#Text=Take the ferry " Turisten " .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Halden has numerous restaurants and small cafeterias .
#Text=If you look around inside the town , you can be sure to find a place that match your taste .
#Text=If you just want to get a cheap meal , you could always go to McDonalds , located at Tista Shopping center .
#Text=Erlandsens Conditori . is a 150 year old traditional coffee and pastry shop .
#Text=Curtisen ( situated inside Fredriksten fortress ) .
#Text=Drink
#Text=The harbour is full of places to enjoy a cold beer on a hot summer day .
#Text=The pub " Siste Reis " by the train station is worth a visit , voted to be on of the ten best pubs in Europe !
#Text=At the town square you will find the local micro brewery " Den Gylne Høne " .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Numerous hotels are available .
#Text=Be aware that staying at a hotel is expensive .
#Text=If you are on a low budget , your best option will be to bring a tent and visit one of the camping sites instead .
#Text=Fredriksten Camping is located at the fortress .
#Text=From there you can walk down to the town in less than ten minutes .
#Text=In the suburbs it is possible to book a house near the lake Femsjøen ( 10 km away from Halden ) .
#Text=But before you arrive ask for exact description of how to get there , because without it you will surely get lost .
#Text=It can be done through Norwegian or Danish travel agency ( for example Novasol ) .
